text: The streets are empty. Low fog skims the sidewalks below of a sky. It's slightly fuzzy, slightly surreal.  The vas Angeles is visible in the b.g... No cars parked here ... except -

Silver with deep grill, its sculptured side panels ending scoops ... All cock and balls, it stands alone in the lon before dawn ... An old-school totem to speed and style... SOMEONE approaches... Through the mists of morning ... In leather coat and jack He's early 30s, with the vaguely whimsical confidence of that refuses to fade ... This is RANDALL RAINES, whom they call MEMPHIS - though k quite sure why ... But they do know he's the auto-boost i California ... Memphis approaches the Mustang with a gathering awe ... L crash survivor coming upon an oasis ... He walks around i Admiring it ... Adoring it ... But then a FIREBIRD pulls up alongside him. Its driver - ATLEY JACKSON, early 30s, handsome, jocular leans out for
You gonna steal her or kneel down to her and pray -- ? Memphis looks at him, still enthralled... ATLEY JACKSON (cont'd)

I know, I know ... It's Eleanor ... Just take her, slick. - - And Atley drives off slowly, Memphis looks this way and t No one about ... He removes a SLIM JIM from a deep pocket coat... He slims the door panel ... Pops the button ... o door ... Watch him work. Quick as shit. A SCREWDRIVER appears anot pocket ... He pops the BUTTERFLY to the IGNITION A RATCHET appears... He strips the mechanism... Now a GIZ socket-like device - is pressed into the ignition ... A twist of the wrist ... And the 320-bhp 289 like a jackhammer. The whole thing took 20 seconds. He takes a cassette TAPE from another pocket ... Slaps it deck. Bruce Springsteen's "Ramrod" wails from the coaxial And Memphis floors it... And off they tear... The look on his face suggests a supreme satisfaction ... re-awakening of long-dormant pleasure centers ... A speed fixed and fumy ... He slots in behind Atley Jackson's Firebird ... And slott behind Memphis, in a Z-28, is DONNY ASTRICKY, mid-30s ... On they go ... The fore and aft car providing escort... Except that, from seemingly out of nowhere --

appears behind them... And Donny instantly goes into diversionary tactic ... He through a STOP SIGN ... And the cruiser's bubbles flash o Donny is pulled-over ... Atley and Memphis drive on in th respective vehicles... The UNIFORM COP gets out of his car, goes to Donny. DONNY
Problem, Officer? POLICEMAN
Yes. You're under arrest -- ? DONNY
For running a stop sign? POLICEMAN

For Grand Theft Auto - And off of Donny's look -- We go to Memphis in the Shelby... As FOUR CRUISERS comes toward him, sirens wailing... QUICK SHOTS of Memphis racing the Shelby through the earl harbor town streets ... Sirens peel ... Memphis turns up ... Pins the gas ... The chase is on ... Memphis maneuvers the Mustang with a dazzling aplomb... M gutterballing the car, skating the shoulder, the cops in pursuit ... And now he's picked up another CRUISER... He passes Atley heading in the opposite direction... Atley has picked-up cruisers himself ... Memphis on a straightaway now, speeds up, feels the boost ahead, a ROADBLOCK has formed... How'd they get that depl fast? And behind him, the unmarks blaze ... Guns his bitch... Straight at the roadblock .. Three CRUI a PORTABLE WOODEN BARRICADE... Memphis pins her ... ZOOOO to the roadblock ... And, at the last moment, as the COPS dive out of the way, bangs the gear shift into neutral -- yanks the parking br And the Mustang spins on the straight -- Screeching spin Memphis takes the HARD LEFT ... And he's managed to outrun them... Finding himself above Grand... Looking down ... He can see the secondary pursuit down below ... Atley bei chased... IN THE DISTANCE - Atley is LAUNCHED FROM THE SH the Firebird rolling down a drainage culvert ... Landing with a sickening thud on its back. Memphis is hor
Rescue team presence. Atley being hauled out of the wreck leg is a torn mess ... He's barely conscious... A cuffed Astricky is dragged to a waiting cruiser ... A POLICE CAR pulls up ... And out steps

of G.R.A.B. The Governor's Regional Auto-theft Bureau. Ca is mid-50s, black, saturnine. - But don't let the tacit n fool you - the man's a street viper ... Castlebeck goes to another cop - HAWKINGS.. HAWKINGS
Astricky. And Jackson. No sign of Raines... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

Well, then it's all for naught, ain't it, Hawkings? Castlebeck looks out over the mess ... And then looks up. Because, further down Lower Grand, a car is parked. It is Shelby. With Memphis leaning against its hood... Castlebeck looks around him, but no one's noticed. So he toward it, hand on hip... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
I know you -- MEMPHIS
You know my back - DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
You want to come along quiet? MEMPHIS
How's Atley -- ? DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

Leg's all banged-up. He made a stupid play ... He'll limp around the yard up at Folsom. But Astricky will be there to take care of him. With their priors, they're looking at a serious bounce -- MEMPHIS
Let them go -- DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
How's that? MEMPHIS
Let them go. And I'll leave ... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
You'll leave -- ? MEMPHIS

You don't have anything on me. A misdee auto-theft. I got no record. I'll be out in three days, and back at  it. Or you let them go, and I give you my word. I'm gone. And without the ringleader ... Your tee-times have just grown exponentially... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
I don't golf... And they stare at each other, as Castlebeck considers. DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK (cont'd)
I do this. And I see you again. I'll come after you with everything I got. you won't be able to steal a glance at a blind man without me by your side ... MEMPHIS
You have my word... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
Get out of here, then. Now. And Memphis makes to get into the Shelby... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

Leave the car, Randall ... Memphis nods ... Takes one last look at the Shelby... Sor leave it behind ... And he runs off into the mists of Low Grand ... Castlebeck walks back toward the crime-scene tumult ... DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
Arright, let lim go. Cite him for rolling the stop ... And cite old Atley for driving to endanger ... HAWKINGS
What are you talking about, Rollie? We're springing 'em? Just like that? DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
Just like that. Quit your bellyaching, Hawkings ... And let's wrap this up ... And off of Donny's surprised look, as Springsteen wails t crescendo and we

Some 400 miles North of Los Angeles, Independence is a on horse town, and the horse has died... Single stop light, single-engine firehouse, single everything. Norman Rockwe would find this burg a snooze.. - We settle on a small, GARAGE ... The peeling sign reads:
owned and operated by Memphis Raines ... In blue coverall Memphis has a Plymouth Duster up on the lift ... With him - TOM, 19... Lightnin' Hopkins' "Automobile Blues" plays MEMPHIS
You know what you got here? TOM
Not really - MEMPHIS
There's excessive resistance in the cranking circuit ... You know what you gotta do -- ? TOM
Not really -- MEMPHIS
You have any other answers besides "not really"? TOM
Not -- MEMPHIS

Right. You want to test the voltage drop ... Use the voltmeter ... Remove the primary lead from the ignitioncoil and crank her ... See what you got ... You understand -- ? Tom starts to say "not really". Instead, he nods. Memphis root beer from an old-style machine. He goes out ... fron where an old Denver Pyle-coot - BUDGY - sits on a bench, an unfiltered Lucky ... Memphis sits beside him, pets the 200-year-old DOG that lounges nearby... BUDGY
Just can't find good help these days -- MEMPHIS (re: cigarette)
Those things'll kill ya, Budgy -- BUDGY
They won't have a chance. The bourbon and bacon'll get me first... Budgy cackles ... Memphis looks out at the dusty little h Budgy points at a passing car ... BUDGY (cont'd)
That one - MEMPHIS

1980 Mercury Cougar. 255 cubic inch V8 ... Based on the Ford Thunderbird bodyshell; they modified the chassis, but didn't improve its performance... Budgy points at another car ... And we get the sense they this game every day... MEMPHIS (cont'd)

The 1970 Plymouth Road Runner. Proof positive of a single all-powerful Deity. The first bargain-priced muscle car ever. They even tuned the horn to resemble the "beep beep" sound of the cartoon Road Runner ... And Budgy looks impressed... As always ... BUDGY
Damn, you're good Memphis nods ... Sips his root beer ... BUDGY (cont'd)
You got to bingo last night? Memphis looks at him ... Can't believe it himself ... MEMPHIS
That I did, Budgy. That I did -- And, from inside the garage, there's the most horrific GR metal on metal, as Tom has started the Plymouth - TOM (O.S.)
Uh ... Randall -- ? MEMPHIS
Excuse me -- Memphis goes back into the garage, Budgy cackles.

A FORD ESCORT - driving through the upscale streets of Pa Verdes. Three KIDS, 20, inside ... The driver is FREB, a dim; in the back is MIRROR MAN, black, always wears those shades ... In the passenger seat is KIP - Memphis' younger brother ... The car pulls to a sto Fancy stores - all of them closed - line this affluent bu district ... Freb consults a piece of paper ... FREB
The corner of Hawthorne and Granvia. Tumbler messed up. He said the Lotus would be at the corner of Hawthorne and Granvia -- KIP

He didn't mess up. There it is ... And he points ... To a CORNER BUILDING - EXOTIC MOTORS LT foot high glass - windows surround a SHOWROOM of EXOTIC D CARS: Porsches and Ferraris, Lamborghinis and Bertones .. there it is, a 1996 LOTUS ESPRIT V8, gleaming in the all- showroom lights... Freb and Mirror Man are startled FREB
That -- ? MIRROR MAN
You're shittin', right? Kip? He grins at them... He ain't shittin'... FREB
How are we supposed to-- KIP
Pop the trunk. I need my tool ... Freb scowls ... Pops the trunk ... Kip gets out ... Goes back ... Freb and Mirror Man share a spook -- MIRROR MAN
What tool -- ? Kip reaches into the trunk.... Comes around to them... He carrying A BRICK -- MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
Oh, no -- And Kip walks toward "Exotic Motors"... Calm and cool ... Ten feet from it ... He winds up ... And HURLS THE BRICK THE WINDOW Which EXPLODES ON IMPACT, a SHOWER OF GLASS raining down ...
As Kip walks into the showroom, glass crunching underfoot and Mirror Man can't believe it --

Kip goes to the Lotus... With nary a glance around, he's open ... The Lotus' ALARM adds its song to the choir ... unmindful, gets behind the wheel ... Screwdriver to the mechanism... The alarm raging in here... In moments, the V8's massive 349bhp is bellowing... And M climbs in beside him... And off they go ... Laying severa of English rubber. Over the broken glass and out of the showroom...
The Lotus races through these streets ... At high speeds MIRROR MAN
Newsflash, Kip: you're driving a stolen car Kip smiles over the ascending speedometer -- KIP
Yeah. Ain't it great -- ? And he pins her ... VROOOOOM -- !
being bounced against the wall ... Caught ... Bounced aga Thunk! Thunk! Thunk!

A dozen purloined AUTOS are parked here ... And a number SHIPPING CONTAINERS ... A thuggish MAN reads the paper .. tennis ball bouncer is TUMBLER, 20 ... And he's sitting o tilted back chair, and wall-bouncing the ball and annoyin piss out of
whom we remember from the drop-car at our opening ... Atl with a LIMP now... Thunk! Thunk! Thunk! ATLEY JACKSON
Can you stop that, for Chrissake? TUMBLER
What's your problem, bro ? Thunk! Thunk! ATLEY JACKSON
Where are they -- ? TUMBLER

They'll be here. You nervous, bro? You? Back in the day, they say you had anti-freeze in them veins ... What happened -- ? And Atley intercepts the tennis ball ... And hurls it ove far side of the warehouse ... Tumbler merely grins ... TUMBLER (cont'd)
Relax and enjoy --

Heading for Long Beach... Stopped at a light ... A CAMARO next to them... A KID behind the wheel, a BLONDE beside h Kip eyeballs them... Engines are revved... Challenges are implied... Mirror Man panics ... MIRROR MAN
Stolen car, Kip. Stolen car, stolen car, stolen car ... KIP

Stolen fast car... And the light turns green ... And he pops the clutch ... they are off ... It's a good old fashioned drag race ... smiles at the blonde ... Mirror Man is freaking out ... K eyes are on fire ... He clocks the speedometer ... KIP (cont'd)
It's calibrated for 140 ... Let's see if these British boys are full of shit or not -- MIRROR MAN

No way, man -- Yes, way. Kip floors it. They bury the Camaro in its wake gauge rising ... 90, 100, 110 ... Mirror Man is having an embolism... They warp-speed by a POLICE CRUISER... Both kids totally of the POLICE CHOPPER up on high... With them in its sigh And they drive ... At last, ending up at -- THE WATERFRONT - A dark latticework of docks and wharves, warehouses and shipping crates... The freighters are some graceful against the moonlit water ...
Tumbler studies his watch... Now he's a little concerned looks up ... Atley is glaring at him... ATLEY JACKSON
Something wrong, Tumbler -- ? TUMBLER

Yeah. I'm missing Springer -- And then the Lotus pulls into the warehouse... Tumbler fl Atley a "told-you-so" smile... Kip and Mirror Man get out car... Kip walks over to a CLIPBOARD with a magic marker tethere ... It is a list of cars ... He draws a black line throug 1996 Lotus Esprit V8"... The others are clocking the car. ATLEY JACKSON
She'll go 0 to 60 in 4.9 seconds -- MIRROR MAN
I can vouch for that. Tumbler passes out 40 oz.s ... The vibe is celebratory... TUMBLER
Thirteen down ... Thirty-seven to go ... KIP

No problem - Bottles are clinked... Beer is sipped ... Only, a HOT WHI SPOTLIGHT bores through the skylight ... And the whup-whu chopper's ROTORS... And now the sounds of SIRENS ... And thuggish man gets to his feet ... THUGGISH MAN
Let's get outta here -- ! And they do... Heading out the back ... It's tough for At his limp ... On the way out: ATLEY JACKSON
Now you gone and done it, Raines And they flee ...

A HALF-DOZEN POLICE CARS. The CHOPPER does the usual spotlight-trailing... It's turned into a total pig circus ... A car pulls to a stop ... And out steps Detect Roland Castlebeck, whom we remember from our opening...
Castlebeck surmises the take ... The cars ... His partner DETECTIVE DRYCOFF - a sneering Irish boy with zero patien comes out from the back ... DETECTIVE DRYCOFF
They're gone... Castlebeck nods ... Looks at the cars ...

Memphis goes through invoices in the cluttered back offic brand new purple MERCEDES SLK, windows tinted, pulls in o It looks oddly anachronistic here in Independence. Memphi danger. He goes out. Budgy and his dog are here... Budgy spooked... Tom, too ... MEMPHIS
What's going on -- ? And standing there, by the Mercedes, like a wraith, is AT JACKSON, in long leather coat, smoking a cigarette ... As place here as a maggot on a muffin... ATLEY JACKSON
Well, well, well ... And he begins to sing... ATLEY JACKSON (cont'd) (ANDY GRIFFITH theme)
Da-doo-doo-doo-da-doo-doo-doo, etc. (laughs)
Are you kidding me, man -- ? MEMPHIS
Hello, Atley ... ATLEY JACKSON (re: sign)
L.N. ORR. I get it. Clever ... Memphis studies him... MEMPHIS
How's the leg? ATLEY JACKSON
Only hurts when I breathe. Lookit you. Where are Barney Fife and Aunt Bea hanging out? And Opie ... Where's Opie at? He laughs some more ... Chain-lights his cig ... MEMPHIS
What are you doing here? ATLEY JACKSON
Is there someplace we can talk? Memphis looks at him... MEMPHIS
What about? ATLEY JACKSON
About your brother. And the deeeep shit he's in --
A BARMAID sets down a pitcher of beer and two mugs... WAITRESS
There you go -- MEMPHIS
Thanks, Donna -- She leaves... Atley is staring at him... Memphis shrugs.. ATLEY JACKSON
It's been a long time, Memphis -- MEMPHIS
Six years ... ATLEY JACKSON
Six years. Shit. Time flies, don't it? Six years ago we were fartin' through Armani and pissin' Cristal. Now look at us ...
Tell me about Kip - Atley takes a sip of his beer,... ATLEY JACKSON
He took a job. And he fumbled it. Now he's jammed-up. Jammed-up bad... MEMPHIS
What kind of job... ? ATLEY JACKSON
A boost. A big boost ... MEMPHIS
A boost? What's Kip doing on a boost? Atley frowns ... Looks at him... ATLEY JACKSON
You're shittin', right? Clearly Memphis is not ... ATLEY JACKSON (cont'd)
Kip's become quite the little crewrunner since you left. He's been working a low-rent ring for two years now. You don't talk to your Ma? MEMPHIS
It seems she neglected to mention it ATLEY JACKSON
Maybe she don't know. Although I don't see how that could be. Maybe she didn't want to upset you - MEMPHIS
Don't feel the need to explore my family dynamics, Atley... ATLEY JACKSON

The point is: Kip's been living the life. Only he's a wild child. Crazy. Makes our old behavior seem like altar boy time. But he fungold this one so bad, folks around L.B. are already speakin' about him in the past tense. Memphis takes a beat ... Sips at his brew ... Then: MEMPHIS
Who was the job for? ATLEY JACKSON
Who do you think? Memphis waits ... In no mood for guessing games ... ATLEY JACKSON (cont'd)
Calitri, man. Raymond "The Carpenter" Calitri ... Your favorite and mine ... Which means nothing to us ... Though the look on Memphis, speaks volumes ... ATLEY JACKSON (cont'd)

I just thought you should know, man. I kind of had a feeling you didn't. But I should tell you: I'm working for him now - The Carpenter - so if you see him, you won't mention me coming to get you... Like I said: I just thought ... I owed you ... And that it was the right thing to do ... Memphis nods ... His face clenched in despair. We FADE TO As a SUPER on-screen reads: PART 1: STOLEN MOMENTS We PRE-LAP J. Geils Band's "Hard-Drivin' Man" and CUT TO:

head_text.subj: THREE PLATES OF BACON, EGGS AND HASH BROWNS

text: placed on the service deck by a short-order COOK...
A 24-hour diner in the heart of Long Beach... The three p picked-up with an impressive dexterity by
early 60s, clear-eyed... In pink Ruby's uniform and chunk shoes... Black currant hair striated with wisps of gray.. delivers the plates to a booth of college kids ... KID
Can I get some more coffee -- ? HELEN RAINES
Sure, hon ... And she goes to the coffee station... When MEMPHIS (O.S.)
Who's a guy gotta know to get a tuna melt in this joint -- ? And she turns around to see Memphis standing there. Her e displays many things ... Most of them joy ... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Hello, Ma -- And she goes to Memphis ... Wraps her arms around him ... tight ... HELEN RAINES (cont'd)
Oh, Randall ... She takes his head in her hands ... Kisses his cheek ... other... Hugs on ... Unmindful of the customers ... The c smiles from behind the order wheel ... COOK
What's the word, Memphis -- ? MEMPHIS
How ya doing, Ruby -- ? HELEN RAINES
Come, come, come ... And she leads him over to a booth ... Barking to the cook on the way... HELEN RAINES (cont'd)
Tuna melt on pumpernickel.  Provolone, extra tomato, Dijon... And a chocolate milk... Lots of syrup... (to Memphis)
Right? MEMPHIS
Right ... And they settle in ... Across the booth from each other . takes his hands... HELEN RAINES
You look good... MEMPHIS
You, too, Ma... HELEN RAINES
What are you doing back? MEMPHIS
How's Kip? And Helen flushes, a bit ashamed maybe ... HELEN RAINES
Have you seen him? MEMPHIS
No. HELEN RAINES
oh. MEMPHIS
Atley Jackson came to see me ... HELEN RAINES
Atley Jackson. How is that one? How's the leg... ? He looks at her ... Beat ... MEMPHIS
Why didn't you tell me? HELEN RAINES
I couldn't. I didn't want you to worry. I thought held sort himself out. I hardly see him. He comes and goes. He's in trouble, isn't he? MEMPHIS
He's in some trouble ... HELEN RAINES
I knew it. He's changed, Randall. He's a different boy. He's lost that... That sweetness ... It's gone ... And I don't know what to do ... MEMPHIS
You getting my checks ... ? HELEN RAINES
Of course ... ANGLE - RUBY. He's on the PHONE in the kitchen...One eye on Memphis and Helen -- RUBY
Detective Castlebeck... It's me ... Yeah... You ain't never gonna guess who just come in to visit his Ma -- BACK TO - MEMPHIS AND HELEN RAINES ... HELEN RAINES (cont'd)
You haven't spoken to him in a while, I guess... MEMPHIS
He doesn't return my calls. or my letters ... HELEN RAINES
Kipling was sixteen when you left, baby. I don't know what you remember of him. But you should brace yourself And, on her sad smile, we PRE-LAP Sammy Hagar's "I Can't and SLAM CUT TO:

A dozen tables... Smells of blue chalk and whiskey... The cranked... We take it to the back of the joint ... Where Tumbler and Mirror Man are knocking a rack... Freb sits n with a few badly made-up GIRLS... TUMBLER
... so ... It's my new move ... It's called "The Stranger." What I do is, I sit on my hand for 10 minutes.  Till it falls asleep. Till it's good and numb. No feeling. And then I jerk off. GIRL
That's disgusting - FREB
What's the point, man -- ? TUMBLER
Cos it's like you're bein' done by a stranger ... It rocks ... It's the power move of the New Millennium... He sinks another ball. A kid, 15, TOBY - comes up to them TOBY
Hey, Kip, what's up? KIP
What do you say, Toby?, TOBY
I'm cool - TUMBLER
What do you want, shithead? TOBY
Why you gotta front me like that? I'm talking to Kip -- TUMBLER
Why don't you leave him alone? TOBY
I known Kip longing than you, man ... TUMBLER
Oooh, ain't you the lucky duck -- FREB
Any word, Kip -- ? KIP
No ... And they won't take my calls ... FREB
What does that mean -- ? KIP
It ain't what you'd call a "good sign" He groks their fear... KIP (cont'd)
Look - we managed to get 13 in a week. We just gotta step it up ... FREB
But we only got till Friday. That's four days. And we lost the 13. So's we gotta start over ... Kip looks at him... KIP
That, too ... (off of Freb's look of fright)
Don't sweat it, Freb. We're cool. ANGLE THE FRONT DOOR. For Memphis has entered. He clocks the room. Sees them at the rear ... Walks back KIP
It can be done, man. We just gotta step it up... It's a challenge ... MIRROR MAN
The challenge is not to get our nuts cut-off and shoved down our throats ... TUMBLER
Can I help you, pal -- ? And Kip looks up ... To see Memphis there ... MEMPHIS
Hey, Kip ... KIP
Hello, Memphis -- TUMBLER
"Memphis?" You're Memphis? MEMPHIS
That's right... TUMBLER
Damn. Damn, damn, damn ... FREB
Memphis. Holy shit. It's an honor, man -- And he pumps his hand... Memphis continues to stare at Ki KIP
It's good to see ya, man. You changed your look - MEMPHIS
You, too Hold the stare... The others are excited... FREB
What are you doing back, Memphis? MEMPHIS
Little visit. Check on the family. KIP
It's nice to see ya, man - He smiles ... Memphis eyeballs him... Toby is there ... TOBY
Hey, Memphis. Remember me? Toby Walker. I live next door ... MEMPHIS
Sure. Hey, Toby. You grew up TOBY
Yeah, I'm cool ... And Memphis turns back to Kip, who's picked up a pool cue KIP
Who's got next game -- ? And he makes to rack 'em up ... Then: MIRROR MAN
I get it. You ain't gotta be a genius: Memphis come back to save our bacon! TUMBLER
Shut-up, Mirror Man -- FREB
Izzat true? You come back to save our bacon? MIRROR MAN
Of course it's true. He come to save his brother's dangling ass -- KIP
That can't be it. Cos we don't need saving FREB
We don't -- ? MEMPHIS
He give you an advance -- ? MIRROR MAN
Hell, yeah. Ten larger man Kip shoots him a look... As if he's spoken out of turn .. MEMPHIS
You just give 'im back the money. All's well... The others look glum... Kip laughs ... Long and hard... KIP

"Give lim back the money." "Give 'im back the money..." Be nice. If only we didn't drink the money. And smoke the money. And buy Nikes with the money. And Sony Play Stations with the money. And dirty girls with the money... And Kip sinks a ball ... Memphis looks at the others ... nod... It's true ... The money's gone ... KIP
But don't worry, man. Things are all sweetness and light here... TUMBLER
Things are all leafy and suburban ... MIRROR MAN
The hell they are -- KIP

Sure they are. Although we do appreciate the gesture, Memphis. But we do got it handled... And it was nice to see you -- - Memphis nods ... Looks at all of them... Smiles ... And t REACHES OUT, GRABBING Kip by the collar, yanking him to h and in close, nose to nose ... MEMPHIS

You listen to me, baby brother. You fancy yourself some reat neat tough guy scumbum, well, woop-tee-doo, little puppy with a poundcake. But I remember the days when you used to steal my Colorforms and eat 'em... So you can't stop me from saving your "dangling ass' if that's what I feel like doing... And with that, he shoves Kip back down into his seat, top table, bottles and glasses crashing... And barrels away f the crowd parting like a wound... Kip's crew left stunned, flustered, and maybe a bit impre TUMBLER
Damn... Homeboy's on the dazzle ... And, off of Kip's furious look, we CUT TO:
A chill in the air. Memphis walks toward a range of lowsl buildings ...

A virtual cityscape of dismantled automobile carcasses, p high for as far as the eye can see ... A huge FORK LIFT s a wreck and hauls it over to the CRUSHER... Watch as the FLATTENED, for easy shelving ... Midnight auto nonpareil ... To one side of the yard is a Watch as a HONDA ACCORD, with a BLOODY WINDSHIELD, enters garage. A young Mexican KID driving.
A CAR is CHOPPED ... Pulled apart ... Fenders, doors, pan interiors, air bags ...
Memphis knocks on the door ... A dog-faced MAN opens it . DOG-FACE
Yeah -- ? MEMPHIS
Randall Raines to see Mr. Calitri ...
Memphis follows Dog-face to the back of this building. Fo into another room. Which is

An enormous WOODWORKING SHOP, fully tricked-out with stat art table saws and drill presses, jointers and power plan An antique treadle lathe stands in one corner. A stock la expensive woods - oak, birch, maple, cherry, mahogany - i against the rear wall ... Jars and bottles and cakes of glues, resins, stains and b cram a shelf unit ... There's a MAN here, at a band saw. RAYMOND CALITRI, 59 ... He wears an apron, protective glasses and a lopsided snee Richard Widmark motherfucker - with the diamond hard look cobra. The liegelord of downtown... And now he works the a hand saw, making critical cross-cu wide panel of maple ... Atley Jackson is here as well ... as it is out in the yard, in here, once the door is close as SILENT-as a tomb... A BANK OF MONITORS on one wall show the cars being crushe disassembled in the yard. Memphis is led into the room. Calitri nods and Dog-face leaves the room... Calitri smil Examines his fresh cut... CALITRI
Randall Raines ... It's been a long time ... (looks at his clothes;) frowns)
'though I do I recall you as a man with style. You remember your old friend, Atley -- ? MEMPHIS
How ya doing? ATLEY JACKSON
Good to see you, Memphis -- CALITRI
So. What do we owe the honor -- ? MEMPHIS
It's about my brother ... Kip... CALITRI

Yes ... Kip ... He says the name like other men say "cancer." The phone o his desk BLINKS. Calitri picks it up. Listens. Looks at one of the monitors. Where the Mexican man is talking to several Calitri EMPLOYEES. Calitri hangs up... CALITRI
Excuse me one moment, Randall ... And he picks up a MORTISE CHISEL on his way out. Palming
is sobbing. As Raymond Calitri marches toward him, glanci bloodied windshield. CALITRI

You bring this to me in this condition? Blood and guts all over it? You make me complicit? On my property? Who taught you how to think? And worst of all: weren't there supposed to be two Hondas? THIEF
Please ... And Calitri, rapid-fire, PUNCTURES the man's belly and ch legs with the chisel, old-school prison-shiv style ... Un man is on the floor, howling ... CALITRI
Stupid sonuvabitch...
Memphis can-see this from one of the monitors. He looks a Atley... ATLEY JACKSON
Car-jacker. Neglected to clean up after himself ... MEMPHIS
Jesus ... ATLEY JACKSON
The business has changed... Calitri is back, wiping the sweat from his brow with a ra CALITRI

Memphis walks out... Going over to the PARKED CAR across street ... Castlebeck... MEMPHIS
I'm on the move - DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
Your girl works in there ... MEMPHIS
Not my girl anymore DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK
Yet your still here ... I gave you 24 hours, 24 hours ago ... MEMPHIS
What do you want from me? DETECTIVE CASTLEBECK

Honestly? I want to - once every few months - get into my car. Pack a lunch. And drive on up to Chino. On visiting day. Bring you some magazines. Maybe some almond clusters. And see you all bright and shiny in your orange jumpsuit. That's what I want ... And with that, he starts his car ... Drives off... Memphi after him...
Memphis drives. Kip beside him. They drive in silence. At coming to:
A huge trucking company warehouse. Kip gets out. Bolt-cut chain-fence out front. And Memphis drives on in, passing the long rows of gargan CAR CARRIERS here. He picks one ... MEMPHIS

This one ... He slim-jims the door ... But the ALARM goes off ... A wi whooping alarm ... Deafening... Try as he might, he can't off. He pops the trunk. Looks for wires ... Nothing. Then, at once, it goes off. Memphis turns. Kip is there. a little DEVICE. MEMPHIS (cont'd)
What's that thing -- ? KIP
Reads the infrared. Then kills it. Little something the R & D department came up with ... MEMPHIS
How long were you gonna let me try and stop it...? KIP
After a while, it became a little pathetic ... Figured I'd put you out of your misery ... MEMPHIS
Thank-you ... KIP
De nada ... He gets behind the wheel. Pops the ignition. The truck's stack belches. Memphis climbs in next to him. MEMPHIS
Ain't we good-timing here ... ? KIP
The family that steals together, deals together... MEMPHIS
Dad'd be proud -- KIP
Maybe not. But Dad was from another era... MEMPHIS
What era was that -- ? KIP
The era when crime didn't pay -- MEMPHIS
As opposed to now, Kid Car Crusher? KIP
Price of doing business... MEMPHIS
What about just getting a job, 9 to 5, five days a week, that whole mystery achievement -- ? KIP

It's for assholes. The Legal Buck blows, Memphis.  You know that. Doing this, we make mad bank, my boys are down, the girlies come around and the boosts are a breeze. Yeah, sure, you're gonna get jacked-up every now and then - but ain't that a small price to pay for never, never-ever, having to say "paper or plastic?" And he grins and puts the truck into gear. And off they g

The Replacements chime in with "Someone Take The Wheel." and the crew ... All but Sway are present. Tumbler and Mirror Man follow Memphis to one side of the To a window ... He gestures outside to where we see and U CAR and the orange glow of two cigarettes ... Staking the MEMPHIS
We've got to shake them tomorrow night. I'm making that your problem. That's called delegation of duties. You like it -- ? Mirror Man and Tumbler regard the cops ... MIRROR MAN
Sure, man -- And they follow him back into the garage ... MEMPHIS

Okay. Tomorrow night it's on. Each team has been assigned their ladies. The teams are: me and Sway. Donny and Freb. Kip and Tumbler. Mirror Man, you and The Sphinx ...  Mirror Man looks horrified ... MIRROR MAN
Aw, c'mon, man ... The Sphinx grins at him... TOBY
What about me? MEMPHIS
You'll be at the docks ... Keeping Otto abreast of our progress ... TOBY
How come ... ? MEMPHIS
Because you should be home with Nintendo, listening to The Spice Girls, little man ... TOBY
Come on. Kip, talk to the guy KIP
There's no talkin' to him -- And Otto and Junie come out with two bottles of champagne paper cups ... OTTO (cup raised)

To a safe and successful session of bumping fenders and trading paint. Everyone toasts ... Drinks ... Donny goes to the tape dec PLAY ... And "Little Deuce Coupe" by The Beach Boys BLAST ("Little Deuce Coupe/You don't know what I got...") And all of our guys dance to it ... Singing along ... Ott with Junie; Tumbler with Toby; even The Sphinx lipsyncs t parts ... BEACH BOYS

"Well, I'm not braggin,' babe So don't put me down But I got the fastest set of wheels in town, etc." Yes, it's the requisite rock-to-an-oldie bit ... But God, fun. As they exorcise some pre-boost jitters.  Only Kip s aside from the frolic ... We watch them dance and laugh a for a bit ... And then Atley Jackson is there. And behind him, another GOON... And, finally, Calitri himself stands there. Someone kills the music. They all look at him... Donny an Sphinx nod to Atley ... CALITRI
This is how you're spending my time? Having a sock hop? MEMPHIS
Everyone know Ray Calitri? Pillar of the community ... CALITRI
Look at this. A multi-generational gathering of scumbags ... OTTO
So saith the God of Scumbags -- CALITRI
Hello, Otto. My boys at the dock report no cars have yet to be delivered. And there's only one more night ... OTTO
Getting nervous, Ray? What happens to you, I wonder, if delivery isn't made? Calitri ignores him... Looks at Kip ... CALITRI

With all the free time I've had not counting cars as they're loaded onto my ship, I've managed to sand the cedar inside your box, Kip. This  will protect you from the anaerobic bacteria, that normally thrives in an airless; environment. Thus prolonging decay ... He smiles ... And Kip actually makes a run for him... Onl held back by Tumbler and Donny ... MEMPHIS
Get out of here, Ray -- CALITRI
One more night -- MEMPHIS
Get out -- CALITRI

I hope you know what you're doing. God help you if you don't ... And with that, he leaves, his goons following. Leaving ou crew to stare after him ... And then we FADE TO BLACK... As a SUPER on-screen reads PART III: SWITCHIN'-TO-GLIDE
As Memphis goes through some old boxes. At last, he finds he's looking for ... Opens it ... He takes out its conten His tools, which we remember from the opening ... And the CLOTHING ...
Drycoff and Hawkings wait in their unmarked ... DRYCOFF
Oh, this is a good time -- He lights another cigarette ... The ashtray is overflowin HAWKINGS
How much can one man smoke? DRYCOFF
It's a crime, ain't it? Cos Castlebeck's got a bug up his ass over this guy, I gotta get lung cancer ...
Mirror Man and Tumbler are at the window Memphis brought last night ... Mirror Man has a RADIO TRANSMITTER in his Donny comes by ... DONNY
What are you doing? TUMBLER

Watch and learn, old-timer -- As Mirror Man points the antennae out the window ... A TO 1970 HEMI 'CUDA replica ... Radio-operated, the car speed the curb outside, using parked cars as cover... She reall DONNY
The hell are you doing? MIRROR MAN

Delivering ordnance. Y2K-style. ANGLE - THE 'CUDA. As it cruises along. Is stopped by a d 40 oz. empty... But Mirror Man maneuvers and its back on At last, parking jammed up to the front, right tire of DR HAWKINGS' UNMARKED. TUMBLER
The Hemi Has Landed -- DONNY
Big deal. Now what? MIRROR MAN

What we call: fun and shit. And he hits a button on his radio control ... ANGLE - the 'Cuda. Wedged in front of the tire. As a quartet of thin razor-tipped SPIKES thrust out from the Shaker hood ... A away from the tire's skin ... Mirror Man and Tumbler appe satisfied ... TUMBLER
We can go now --
The one with the Roadster in the living room... The phone The answering machine picks up ... Beeep! VOICE (O.S.)

Yes, this is a message for Mr. Seymour Croft, of 1443 Locklin ... This is the Department of Water and Power and we're going to be doing some work in your area tonight ... If you'd please call us at 555-1877, so we could discuss the...
Freb on this end... He hangs up ...
Judge Croft picking up his messages ... Writes down the n Dials ...
In the van. Kip and Toby... Toby's got his lap-top out .. they've re-routed the lines into it ... The phone rings . answers ... TOBY

Department of Water and Power. Could you hold please ... And before the Judge can respond, they've clicked him on And they make him wait ... And wait ... Just like the rea does ... They high-five... TOBY (cont'd)
Where should we put him? KIP
He's a Judge. He'll only bite for something pimpy - At last, Toby answers ... TOBY
D.W.P. Thanks for holding. How can I help you? JUDGE CROFT
I got a message. I live at 1443 Locklin. TOBY
Yes. can you hold, sir -- ? JUDGE CROFT
NO! No, I can't! I'm a busy man. Kip can hear his anger ... Whispers: KIP
Oooh, she's chafed -- TOBY

okay, sir. Let me just get the-order. Yes. We'll be doing some work out your way. We've got a power leak. And it's unsafe. We're moving residences to the... Marriott Long Beach ... Just for the night ... JUDGE CROFT
Oh, for God's sake TOBY
I know, sir ... And Kip pantomimes eating. Toby, at first puzzled, gets i TOBY (cont'd)
For the inconvenience we're also offering a free breakfast brunch --  JUDGE CROFT
Breakfast brunch -- ? TOBY
Yes, sir - Pause ... They've got him... Thumbs-up ... JUDGE CROFT
Okay, then ... I just go to the Marriott and I'm set ... TOBY
You've been pre-booked... And the Judge hangs up ... TOBY (cont'd)
Goodbye to you, too, assface ...

They all wait, anxious ... Dressed for their night ... An Memphis enters ... Hoots and hollers ... He's dressed in the old duds. Black turtleneck. Black boo pants. Long, black, leather duster. Way too cool for scho Memphis Raines returns... DONNY ASTRICKY
I miss Orville Redenbacher already -- MEMPHIS
Okay, okay. The important thing to remember, is to Think Slow. Take your time. It may not seem like it, but the night is long. Long enough. Just think slow and think smart...
As the crew get into the van... And drive-off ...
Drycoff starts her up... DRYCOFF
Let's see what these bastards are up to -- And' he puts her in gear ... And KA-POW! The front tire E ... Shredded to rim... DRYCOFF (cont'd)
What the fu-- He gets out of the car, goes to the front ... In time to little 'Cuda race off down the street after the crew... DRYCOFF (cont'd)
Those little pricks -- ! ANGLE -- MIRROR MAN. In the back of the van, With his tra Giggling wildly as the 'Cuda zooms after him.

The massive seaport, a series of wharves. Commercial SCOW TUGS beast the black water. We should note the enormous 2 ton, 627-foot CONTAINER SHIP, swaying in the harbor. And shoreside GANTRY CRANE alongside it ...

An expansive warehouse surrounded by chain-link fence ... SHIPPING CONTAINERS are here, in which the stolen cars wi stored. And cartons and cartons of motor oil. A massive FRONT-END-LOADER will transport each container gantry crane, which will lower it onto the cells in the c ships' hold... Each team is ready ... Each has a briefcase containing th of the trade ... Memphis talks into a two-way RADIO ... MEMPHIS
How we doing, O -- ?
Otto stands before The Big Board - with all the ladies' n it ... On the two-way ... OTTO
Ready to start erasing. Good luck, kiddies --
Memphis clicks off ... They climb into 4 Ford Escorts ... MEMPHIS
Okay. All our ladies should be home now, tucked in bed. Let's keep chilly. Think Slow. Any questions? TOBY
You sure I can't go with ya? Memphis' ice-water glance is answer enough ... MEMPHIS
Only use the phones when absolutely necessary... Otto's default HQ ... Let's go get 'em...

Of the four cars, as each team slaps a tape in their deck 1) Kip and Tumbler. The tape is Tupac. They bang fists. 2) Donny Astricky and Freb ... Donny's playing Miles Davi 3) Memphis and Sway ... And Bruce ... MEMPHIS
Ready -- ? SWAY
Oh, yeah. 4) Mirror Man and The Sphinx... The Sphinx puts on GLASSE attached FAKE NOSE, to cover his gnarled one ... MIRROR MAN

You should consider always wearing that, boy... And he slides his tape into the deck... And, as The Gap B "Burn Rubber On Me" cranks on the track - Our team goes out... Into the night ... Toby watching aft them... Because they're off ...
Tumbler and Kip park the massive CAR CARRIER here ... Kip behind him in the Escort... Tumbler gets into the Escort drives off ...
Memphis and Sway in the van ... Searching ... He pulls to ... For a Mazda Rx-7 is parked on this quiet, residential Sway gets out ... Eyeballs it ... Comes back... SWAY
No whistles, but a Club You bring a hack -- ? MEMPHIS

No. Open her ... He parks ... Opens the back of the van ... Sway pulls the window ... Gets in ... Ignition-Gizmos her ... The motor running ... Waits ... Memphis gets in next to her... He h STEERING WHEEL with him. SWAY
What the hell's that -- ? MEMPHIS

A little trick I picked up at the Car Thief Retirement Home ... He uses his screwdriver to REMOVE four rivets on the Mazd Clubbed steering column ... In seconds, the CLUBBED STEER IS REMOVED, Club still on it. Memphis pops in the steerin he brought, jerry-bangs the rivets ... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Let's cruise -- And they do ... Sway rolls down her window ... Tosses som they drive off - ANGLE - THE OLD STEERING WHEEL. "Club" firmly affixed to the ground, in the Mazda's old parking place...

as they systematize the cars they're responsible for... T drops Kip off by a Porsche ... We recognize it as one of Mirror Man cut a key for in the valet scam. Kip selects t from a series of them hooked into his briefcase. He gets the car. He's in. He's off ... TUMBLER - meanwhile, has driven to a Volvo C70... He, too key ... He's in ... He's off ...
Kip drives the Porsche onto it, Tumbler enters the lot in Volvo. QUICK DISSOLVES as they fill it up... Two Honda Ac another Volvo, a Toyota 4-runner, etc.

All is silent. Chainlink fence topped with swirls of leth barbed wire. Mirror Man and The Sphinx are here. Mirror Man goes to the main entry fence doors ... He bolt chain ... The doors slide open ... They're in ...
A Porsche 911 Cabriolet is parked... Donny and Freb look at it ... FREB
Diane 1. DONNY ASTRICKY
Very good. Think you can get in without waking her up -- ? FREB
Yeah. DONNY ASTRICKY
That's an after-market alarm. Can't just cut her wires ... He pops his briefcase ... Takes out some gear ... Gets ou Moves for Diane 1 ...

Helen Raines is rooting through a crowded closet. At last finds what she's looking for ... A small black boxy DEVIC goes to the living room. Plugs in the box ... It is a POLICE SCANNER... And it immediately starts to po ... Helen sits down ... And listens... Her face clenched worry ...
Mirror Man works the thick steel door ... He's got a sled center punch... He knocks the knob off with the sledge an goes to work with an ELECTRIC DRILL ... MIRROR MAN

This is some state-of-the-art shit, kid. The drill breaks the sockets, which force back the spindle and release the lock ...only it doesn't seem to be working... And The Sphinx is getting impatient ...
Tumbler and Kip pull in with their car carrier ... Full.. start to unload it ...
As Otto SWIPES NAMES FROM THE BOARD...
Memphis and Sway... They ride in silence ... She busies h looking through the consul. Comes up with a tube of LIPST the visor mirror to apply it. MEMPHIS
Gosh, no. Lipstick? What next? Mascara, blush, floral-print dresses? SWAY
Deodorant. And she looks at him... She's really laid the lipstick on thick ... But it's oddly effective ... MEMPHIS
Wow. Bozo, the very sexy clown -- Beat. She looks out the window, throws the following away SWAY
So, you seeing anybody? MEMPHIS
No. I had a girl. She was great. The problem is: great girls come along once every ten years. So I gotta wait another three years before I can even bother to look... SWAY
She was so great, why'd you leave her? MEMPHIS
Her parole officer strongly recommended  it ... She looks at him... But he's stopped the car... For Kip a Tumbler are waiting at the side of the street. They get i

Freb dead-shorts the alarm system, grounding it out on th own metal surface, just like they taught him... He's in t Porsche ... It's just that he can't figure out how to get started ... The passenger door opens ... Donny... DONNY ASTRICKY
What's the matter? FREB
It's all microchips and shit ... DONNY ASTRICKY
Yeah? He holds up a screwdriver. Jams it in the steering column DONNY ASTRICKY (cont'd)
I don't care what kind of car it is. How fancy; how expensive; how new. You pop the collar - it's 1966 all over again ... ! He pops the collar - exposing an ordinary ignition system FREB
Cool ...
Memphis drives ... Sway, Kip, Tumbler with him... KIP
So we loaded all of the keyed cars up and dropped 'em ... It was cake ... 8 cars, ba-da-bing ... Memphis looks at him in the rear-view ... MEMPHIS
Having fun, Kip? KIP
Hell, yeah... It's a beautiful business ... (realizes his gaffe)
I mean, no, man, it's hard, it's scary, it sucks ... Memphis looks at Sway, shakes his head... Kills the light they pull in to
Where Mirror Man is still struggling with the lock, his d and punches, scattered about ... MIRROR MAN
Just give me another -- only The Sphinx shoves him aside ... Pulls the GUN from h holster and BLANG! blasts open the lock... Mirror Man stares at the opened door ... MIRROR MAN
Oh, I get it: old school. And Memphis and the others drive up ... MEMPHIS
How's it going? MIRROR MAN
It's going fine. The Quiet Riot and me are swapping trade secrets ... And in they go --
Dark as pitch. Flashlights come on. To reveal

head_text.subj: ROW UPON ROW OF GLEAMING FERRARIS

text: Old and new models. Daytonas and Boxers and Dinos and Testarossas. There must be at least fifty of them here. Flashlight beams dance over car after car. It's a treasur of automotive jewels ... All of our heroes are in awe. An soft whimpering. They turn. To see Sway, overcome with em SWAY

It's just... so... beautiful ... And it is Kip that puts an arm around her ... She sobs in chest ... Never taking her eyes from the array of Italian ... Indeed, they are all in something of trance. Memphis first one out -- MEMPHIS
C'mon, gang. Let's focus. Sway, can you prep 'em -- ? SWAY
I think so... They're just... So ... MEMPHIS
I know. But let's prep 'em. We could stay here all night... That wouldn't be good -- The others are still gazing ... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Let's go, people -- And they set to work...
Donny Astricky and Freb have accessed a '61 Jag... Watch takes out 3 screws in the Jag's ignition and removes the thing ... DONNY ASTRICKY
So? Tell me: how come they call you "Freb" anyways -- ? FREB
C'mon, man ... DONNY ASTRICKY
We're partners here -- Freb considers ... Then, reluctantly -- FREB

My names "Fred." You know: Frederick? One drunk night, I decided to give myself a tattoo. Hot needle it. I used a mirror to guide me ... And he pulls up his sleeve - to show the blue "FREB" tatt there ... FREB (cont'd)

The mirror messed me up with the "b" and the "d"... Everything's reversed, you know? Now, I'm "Freb." Donny chooses from a selection of IGNITIONS he's brought Finds the right one ... Installs it ... Tightens the 3 sc Starts the car with his own key ... DONNY ASTRICKY
Glad to know you, "Freberick." Let's roll - And off they go ...
Sway sets to prepping the cars ... The others wait nearby walks over to where Kip sits ... MEMPHIS
You okay -- ? KIP
I'm cool. Memphis looks at his watch... KIP (cont'd)
We gonna make it? MEMPHIS
Too early to tell. Nervous? KIP
Nah. MEMPHIS
That's strange. I'm nervous. Donny's nervous. Everyone's nervous. But not you... KIP
I dunno. Whatever will be will be... MEMPHIS
That's a good attitude, Kip. For everything but stealing cars ... Before Kip can respond, the signature throaty ROAR of Fer fills the room, as Sway's got one started -- MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Showtime --
as Sway gets the Ferraris started, her skill readily appa And each man - Kip, Tumbler, Mirror Man, The Sphinx - cli the wheel and ROAR OFF...
Toby watches as the Ferraris are driven in. He radios Ott
as the four corresponding names are ERASED...
glowing silver; cool wedge shape, 15-degree angled windsc definition of sleek. Memphis and Sway, in the van, roll u Maserati. MEMPHIS
Hello, Tracy... Except that a MAN comes out of the house ... Mid-20s, sil long, leather Prada coat ... Persian'dude ... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Shit. The man climbs into the Maserati. Memphis follows...
Lots of high-end cars. Mirror Man and The Sphinx search t ... At last coming to - MIRROR MAN
Gina -- ! The 188 Lamborghini Countach... They move for it... Stop MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
Check it -- He gettures to the LICENSE PLATE. It reads "SNAKE"... MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
Oooh. "Snake." Tough guy. "Snake." Homeboy wants you to call him: Snaake-! They crack up ... Size her ... MIRROR MAN (cont'd)

No whistles ... That's weird... He shrugs ... They slim-jim her "beetle-wing" articulated Climb in ... The Sphinx starts her up ... Mirror Ma gets him... The seats are sooo low ... MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
This shit's on point. Check it: 200. He gestures to the speedometer ... Calibrated to 200 MPH. MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
Halfway there, we switch. I drive. The Sphinx shrugs ... And they head out ... MIRROR MAN (O.S.)
Say goodbye to your ride, Snake...
Memphis and Sway have followed the Maserati to another bu Idles ... Smokey Robinson's "Cruisin'" croons. MEMPHIS
What's this guy up to -- ? After a beat, a WOMAN comes out ... She gets into the car SWAY
It's 1:30 on a Tuesday. Is that any time to pick a girl up for a date? The Maserati's lights go off... He's parked... SWAY (cont'd)
What, are they gonna mack -- ? Yeah. The couple start kissing. Memphis checks his watch SWAY (cont'd)
Maybe she's got a roommate... Beat ... They watch the couple in the Maserati for a beat
Junie, Otto's gal, on the telephone... JUNIE
... that's right. They'll be in the lobby of the Riviera Building. 2206 Beacon Street. Palos Verdes ... And we go to --

And see a LINCOLN LIMOUSINE pull up outside this posh apa building... The DRIVER gets out ... Heads to the lobby .. Kip and Tumbler step out from the shadows across the stre climb into the limo... Drive off ...
The Sphinx drives ... Mirror Man pops in his tape ... Alb King's "Drivin' Wheel." MIRROR MAN

That's what I'm talkin' about -- ! He boogies down. The Sphinx is bewitched, awed by the car magnificent power. But then Mirror Man SCREAMS -- ! With terror. For, at his feet, wrapped around his legs, is A BOA CONSTRICTOR - some 8-feet long... A mass of heavily scales shimmering on coiled muscle ... Mirror Man screams on... The Sphinx swerves wildly... Racing through a red light. missing an on-coming BUS ... Passing a pair of COPS comin a 7-11. They hop into their unit. Give chase.
The Persian man and his date ... Mackin' hard... Behind t Memphis and Sway wait in the Mazda. Memphis is on the cel MEMPHIS
... okay, check with you soon ... He hangs up ... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Otto says 22 ladies have reported for work... Sway nods ... The Maserati's windows are fully-steamed... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
Man, they're going at it SWAY
They're in love ... Long beat ... He looks at her ... MEMPHIS
What about you? She looks at him... Shrugs... SWAY

You remember my Gramma? Yeah. I was thinking. If she were alive. And she asked me. If she came down, right now. Asked me. "What do you do, Sara? What's your life?" Innocently. Nonjudgemental. I think it would break her heart if I said I was a thief. I steal cars, Gramma. And even though, hey, I learned it all from her son. My Uncle Eddie. Who taught me the basics.  Which you refined. (You remember Randall, Gramma? You thought he was neat. Well, he refined the basics ... ). I don't think that's what she hoped for me... She looks at him ... SWAY (cont'd)

But ... That said... Car thieves are my weakness ... It's all so terribly Loretta Lynn or something, I know... But ... I don't wanna be a thief anymore ... I don't wanna love a thief anymore ... I want to wear a dress maybe once in a while... Maybe have a kid... Watch a lot of Audrey Hepburn movies.. And think about my Gramma without also thinking "shame on me. Shame on me. Shame on me... " She looks at him... He leans into her ... Kisses her... T at first ... Then... With urgency...
Phones ringing like mad... Drycoff walks into Castlebeck' office... DETECTIVE DRYCOFF
It's an epidemic, Rollie ... I'm getting reports every five minutes ...
As "Little Red Corvette" by Prince warbles on the track.. and Sway still kissing... She breaks it for: SWAY
Arright ... Enough ... I can't have you bellying up to my heart again, man, f you can't help falling off the stool. But he puts his mouth to her ears ... MEMPHIS
Shhh... Car thieves are your weakness. Whispers ... MEMPHIS (cont'd)
I approach you. It's quiet. I look this way. That. No one around ... SWAY
Stop. What about Maserati Boy? MEMPHIS
I take out my slim-jim... SWAY
Oh, God... And yes, this is patently absurd. But it's also oddly sex MEMPHIS
Slip it in ... SWAY
You're going high-cheese, dude -- MEMPHIS
Unlock your button ... SWAY
"Unlock my button" ... ? MEMPHIS
The alarms go off ... SWAY
Woo-woo-wooooo! MEMPHIS
I pop your hood; find your siren wires SWAY
They're factory alarms ... Easy to get around... For a man with... Skills... MEMPHIS
I do ... I cut "em... SWAY
Cut 'em... MEMPHIS
Now... I'm in ... SWAY
Of course you are. You're a professional... MEMPHIS
I ratchet your ignition mechanism ... SWAY
I bet you say that to all the girls... MEMPHIS
With a twist of my wrist ... You're turned over ... SWAY
Wrong preposition... MEMPHIS
Hear you roar ... SWAY
What about The Club ... ? MEMPHIS
Let me worry about The Club ... SWAY
No worries ... MEMPHIS

I've got you floored... We're off ... Take the curb... Man, can you corner... Know not to get on it ... Momentum shift ... Don't get on those brakes too hard ... Get her up on her tires. Up on her toes. Up ... Up... Up. Back arched... A small moan escapes her ... Prince wails Sway has achieved whatever kind of silly climax they aspi here... She flops back down... Looks at him... SWAY
You're still quite the boost, Randall Raines ... (he shrugs)
Except now I've been chopped, and my parts are in a Honda Prelude being driven to church in South America by some Bolivian consulate's wife ... MEMPHIS
And Tracy's on the move ... Indeed, the girl has gotten out of the Maserati... And th rocketed off... Memphis punches the gas,'sending Sway to SWAY
Wham, bam, thank-you, Ma'am, point- five ... PRE-LAP Alice Cooper's "Under My Wheels" and SLAM CUT TO:
CLOSE UP OF THE "SNAKE" LICENSE PLATE as its ass-end fish like a bastard... The Sphinx is outrunning what is now a  half-dozen CRUISERS ...
is freaking out ... The snake wrapped all around him... MIRROR MAN
What do I do? What do I do? Aw, man. He's gonna swallow my shit whole  Let's go to a hospital or something! But The Sphinx shakes his head. No. MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
C'mon, you creepy no-nosed motherfucker. Take me to a hospital! Nope. The Sphinx drives on... Into yet another
This one even cooler than the last ... And once they've e of the police, The Sphinx pulls over to the side of a DAR STREET... MIRROR MAN
What are you doing? I'm gonna die! The Sphinx leans over... And PINCHES THE SNAKE BEHIND THE THE HEAD... MIRROR MAN (cont'd)

You tryin' to make him more mad? But, miraculously, the snake RELAXES ITS GRIP on Mirror M slithers off... To the back of the car ... Where it immed goes back to sleep ... Mirror Man stares at Sphinx, who s genially. Then: MIRROR MAN (cont'd)
I never thought it'd be possible: but your ass just got spookier ...
Freb and Donny Astricky have gotten "Laura", a '99 Bentle started... FREB
You ever feel bad about any of this? DONNY ASTRICKY
Of course not. I'm Robin Hood. I take from the rich, and give to the needy... FREB
You mean the poor -- DONNY ASTRICKY
No. The needy. Us. Cos we need this car! And Donny puts her in gear, When a GUN is jammed agains't temple ... JACKER
Out of the car, bitch, or I blow your fucking head off -- ! Donny looks at the jacker... Surprised... It is a KID ... than 16 ... DONNY ASTRICKY
Are you kidding me -- ? JACKER
DONNY ASTRICKY
I'm stealing this car. So BACK OFF! JACKER
